term.title: catabolism

item.text: Reactions involving the oxidation of organic substrates to provide chemically available energy (e.g. ATP) and to generate metabolic intermediates.
Generally, the process of breakdown of complex molecules into simpler ones, often providing biologically available energy.

term.sources: 'Glossary for chemists of terms used in toxicology (IUPAC Recommendations 1993)' Duffus, J.; Pure and Applied Chemistry 1993 65(9) 2003
term.citation: Citation: 'catabolism' in IUPAC Compendium of Chemical Terminology, 5th ed. International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry; 2025. Online version 5.0.0, 2025. 10.1351/goldbook.C00870
